original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 19 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Jan 01 08]
Mr. **NAME[AAA] has done well overnight .
He is without complaints .
This morning on exam he is afebrile .
Vital signs are stable .
He is breathing comfortably between 18 and 24 times a minute .
Oxygen saturations are 98% on six liters nasal cannula .
Chest is clear .
Abdomen is soft .
His extremities are warm and well-perfused .
Laboratory examination shows a mild hyponatremia .
His bicarbonate is up to 35 with his diuresis .
Ins and outs were overall net negative .
Today I have discontinued his Lasix .
I have changed his intravenous Dilaudid to p.o.
We have got him out of bed into a chair .
He is tolerating his tube feeds and should be stable for transfer out of the intensive care unit .
___________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Jan 01 2008] 20:47:05
T :
**DATE[Jan 01 2008] 20:58:19
R :
**DATE[Jan 01 2008] 20:58:19/caa
Job ID :
409867 /**ID-NUM
CC:
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[XXX , SSS M]. ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[WWW XXX]
**DATE[Jan 19 2008] 02:55:27 PM
